intro: Campylocentrum loretoense, commonly known as the Loreto starfruit, is a species of flowering plant in the family Marcgraviaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its ornamental leaves, which are glossy and deeply veined. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The fruit, when mature, is a small, star-shaped structure that is edible and has a sweet, tangy flavor.
